greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the result of beginning with n and iterating k -> A064916(k) until a prime is reached.
comment: Well-defined since A064916(n) < n for nonprimes.
a(p) = p for all primes p.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
Michael Gilleland, Some Self-Similar Integer Sequences
program: (PARI) lpf(n)= { local(f); f=factor(n); return(f[1, 1]) } { for (n=2, 1000, m=n; while (!isprime(m), L=lpf(m); m=m / L + L - 1); write("b064917.txt", n, " ", m) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Sep 29 2009
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 14 2001
